[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Counter overflow] Can the Prometheus counter types overflow if FAILED_TO_UPLOAD_TO_GCS_COUNT or other metrics are incremented billions of times, causing metric resets and monitoring gaps? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Monitoring blind spot] If counter increments fail or are delayed, can successful attacks go undetected because metrics don't reflect actual upload activity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Metric race condition] Are the counter operations atomic, or can race conditions cause incorrect counts that hide the true scale of upload failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Malicious NFT metadata injection] Can an attacker craft malicious JSON metadata containing XSS payloads, phishing URLs, or misleading information that gets stored and served to users viewing NFT marketplaces? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Polyglot file upload] Can an attacker upload polyglot files (valid as both image and executable) that bypass security scanners but execute malicious code when opened by users? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Metadata replacement attack] By exploiting hash collisions or race conditions, can an attacker replace legitimate NFT metadata with fake metadata to commit fraud or manipulate NFT values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Image bomb DoS] Can an attacker upload specially crafted image bombs (decompression bombs) that when processed by downstream systems cause memory exhaustion or crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Storage cost attack] Can attackers flood the system with massive JSON uploads to inflate GCS storage costs, causing economic denial of service? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Bandwidth exhaustion] Can repeated uploads of large images exhaust network bandwidth between the crawler and GCS, degrading service for legitimate operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Hardcoded timeout vulnerability] Is the MAX_RETRY_TIME_SECONDS constant of 2 seconds too aggressive for production use, causing legitimate large uploads to fail and resulting in incomplete NFT metadata indexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Backoff configuration attack] If the ExponentialBackoff defaults are not optimal, can this be exploited to cause either too many retries (resource exhaustion) or too few retries (data loss)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Timeout configuration tampering] Can an attacker manipulate the MAX_RETRY_TIME_SECONDS constant through environment variables or configuration injection to disable retries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Public bucket exposure] If the target GCS bucket is accidentally configured as public, could this expose all uploaded NFT metadata to unauthorized access or modification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Bucket ACL bypass] Does the upload operation respect bucket-level ACLs, or can it bypass access controls through misconfigured UploadObjectRequest parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Cross-origin contamination] Can uploads to the wrong bucket due to parameter confusion cause legitimate NFT data to be stored in development, test, or attacker-controlled buckets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Object lifecycle policy] Are uploaded objects subject to lifecycle policies that might delete them prematurely, causing permanent NFT metadata loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Filename disclosure] Does returning the full filename path reveal internal storage structure that could be exploited by attackers to predict or enumerate other NFT metadata locations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Success confirmation bypass] Can the function return Ok(filename) even if the upload was only partially successful, hiding data corruption from callers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Error detail leakage] Do error return values leak sensitive information about GCS infrastructure, bucket names, or authentication that could aid attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Birthday attack on hash] With SHA256 providing 256-bit security, is the hash space large enough to prevent birthday attacks where attackers can find colliding URIs with reasonable computational effort given the scale of NFT metadata? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Hash preimage attack] Can attackers generate URIs that hash to specific values to overwrite targeted NFT metadata by computing SHA256 preimages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Deterministic hash exploitation] Since SHA256 is deterministic, can attackers exploit this to predict filename locations and perform targeted attacks or data poisoning? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Empty URI handling] What happens if uri is an empty string - does sha256::digest('') create a collision point where all empty URIs map to the same file? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_image_to_gcs()] [Zero-length buffer] Can uploading an empty buffer (buffer.len() == 0) bypass validation or cause unexpected behavior in GCS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/nft-metadata-crawler/src/utils/gcs.rs] [Function: write_json_to_gcs()] [Null JSON handling] What happens if json parameter is a null Value - does this cause panics, upload failures, or create invalid stored files? (Medium)
